en.title: Supplement Dose Calculator
en.p: Calculate the recommended maximum daily dosage.
en.disclaimer: This document is for general health information and is not a substitute for medical advice. Recommended amounts and side effect risks vary completely depending on individual health status, presence of disease, and medications being taken. Before starting or changing your intake of supplements, be sure to consult a doctor or pharmacist for a professional diagnosis.
en.proteinSubtypes: Whey, Casein, BCAA (Branched-Chain Amino Acids), etc.
en.proteinPros:
• Component of body tissues such as muscles, skin, and hair.
  • Essential for producing enzymes and hormones.
  • People who want to increase or maintain muscle mass, people who need recovery after exercise.
  • The elderly or vegetarians who lack protein intake from meals.
en.proteinConsTitle: ğŸ‘ Disadvantages (Side Effects of Overdose & Precautions)
en.proteinCons:
• Kidney burden: Excessive protein can burden the kidneys during decomposition. (Especially for those with kidney disease)
  • Indigestion: Consuming too much at once can cause gas and bloating.
en.proteinDosageGuide:
• General adult: Body weight (kg) Ã— 0.8g ~ 1.0g
  • Active adult: Body weight (kg) Ã— 1.2g ~ 1.6g
  • Muscle gain goal: Body weight (kg) Ã— 1.6g ~ 2.0g
en.proteinDosageUpper: Upper limit: It is generally recommended not to exceed 2.0g per 1kg of body weight.
en.vitaminBIntro: All figures below are based on adults and should not be exceeded regardless of body weight.
en.b1Pros: Core of energy metabolism. Necessary for chronic fatigue and decreased nervous system function.
en.b1Cons: Toxicity is very low and rarely reported.
en.b2Pros: Energy production, prevention of stomatitis. Maintains skin and mucous membrane health.
en.b2Cons: Urine turns fluorescent, but it is harmless. Low toxicity.
en.b3Pros: Energy metabolism, improvement of blood cholesterol, skin health.
en.b3Cons: Niacin flush (skin redness, hot flash), gastrointestinal disorders.
en.b5Pros: Stress relief, energy production, skin and hair health.
en.b5Cons: Toxicity is very low and rarely reported.
en.b6Pros: Protein metabolism, neurotransmitter (serotonin) production, women's health.
en.b6Cons: Risk of nerve damage (numbness in hands and feet) with long-term overdose.
en.b7Pros: Essential for maintaining healthy hair, skin, and nails.
en.b7Cons: Low toxicity. (However, it may affect some blood test results)
en.b9Pros: Cell division/growth, DNA synthesis. Essential for preventing birth defects in pregnant women.
en.b9Cons: Can mask B12 deficiency and worsen nerve damage.
en.b12Pros: Red blood cell production, maintenance of nervous system function. Essential for vegetarians.
en.b12Cons: Toxicity is very low and rarely reported.
en.vitaminCPros: Powerful antioxidant, immunity boost, collagen synthesis, skin beauty.
en.vitaminCCons: Gastrointestinal disorders such as diarrhea, abdominal pain, heartburn. Possible increased risk of kidney stones.
en.vitaminAPros: Vision protection (especially night blindness), skin and mucous membrane health, immunity.
en.vitaminACons: Acute/chronic toxicity (headache, nausea, liver damage). Risk of birth defects with overdose in pregnant women.
en.vitaminDPros: Promotes calcium absorption, bone health, immune regulation. Essential for modern people who lack sunlight.
en.vitaminDCons: Hypercalcemia (excess calcium in the blood), nausea, risk of kidney stones.
en.vitaminEPros: Powerful antioxidant (anti-aging), improves blood circulation, protects cells.
en.vitaminECons: Inhibits blood clotting. Increased risk of bleeding before surgery or when taking anticoagulants.
en.vitaminKPros: Essential for blood clotting. Maintains bone health (helps calcium stick to bones).
en.vitaminKCons: Low toxicity. However, it interferes with the effectiveness of anticoagulants (warfarin).
en.calciumPros: Main component of bones and teeth. Involved in muscle contraction and nerve transmission.
en.calciumCons: Constipation, gastrointestinal disorders. Interferes with the absorption of other minerals (iron, zinc). Risk of kidney stones.
en.magnesiumPros: Muscle relaxation (relieves eye twitching), nerve stability, energy production, natural tranquilizer.
en.magnesiumCons: Diarrhea. (Especially magnesium oxide with low absorption rate)
en.ironPros: Main component of hemoglobin, prevents anemia. Essential for oxygen transport.
en.ironCons: Constipation, black stools, gastrointestinal disorders. Risk of organ damage if accumulated excessively.
en.zincPros: Normal immune function, cell growth, wound healing, men's health.
en.zincCons: Nausea, vomiting. Long-term overdose can cause copper deficiency and weakened immunity.
en.seleniumCons: Selenosis (hair loss, brittle nails, fatigue, nervous system abnormalities).
en.iodinePros: Raw material for thyroid hormones, regulates metabolism.
en.omega3Pros: Improves blood circulation, reduces neutral fat, anti-inflammatory, brain function, improves dry eyes.
en.omega3Cons: Delayed blood clotting (increased bleeding tendency). Fishy aftertaste.
en.collagenPros: Supports skin elasticity and moisturizing, joint and cartilage health.
en.collagenCons: Generally safe, but may cause allergic reactions or bloating in some people.
en.coq10Pros: Cellular energy production, powerful antioxidant, heart health, blood pressure reduction.
en.coq10Cons: Generally safe. Rarely causes insomnia, gastrointestinal disorders.
